messages.content:
You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to login to my bank account, so that I can be able to check my bank account balance. 
  Write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria: 
  I should be able to login into bank account if username and password are correct. 
  I can not log into bank account if username and password are not correct. 
  I should  view bank balance if the user is login and have permission to view account balance. 
  I should not view account balance if they are login and do not have permission to view account balance.

Feature: Bank Account Login and Balance Checking

  Background: 
    Given the user is on the bank account login page

  @successful-login
  Scenario: User logs in with correct username and password
    When the user enters correct <username> and <password>
    And clicks on the login button
    Then the user is successfully logged in

    @test @dev
    Examples:
      | username | password   |
      | user123  | pass123    |
      | johnDoe  | securePwd  |

  @failed-login
  Scenario: User unable to login with incorrect username and password
    When the user enters incorrect <username> or <password>
    And clicks on the login button
    Then the login attempt fails

    @test @dev
    Examples:
      | username | password     |
      | user321  | wrongPass    |
      | janeDoe  | invalidPwd   |

  @view-balance
  Scenario: User views account balance after successful login
    Given the user is logged in
    And has permission to view account balance
    When the user navigates to the balance page
    Then the user can view the account balance

  @no-view-balance
  Scenario: User unable to view account balance without permission
    Given the user is logged in
    And does not have permission to view account balance
    When the user tries to access the balance page
    Then the account balance is not visible

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to be able to create an accunt, so that I can create my own profile.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria: 
  I should be able to create an account if I do not have an exist account.
  I should be able to create a profile if I have an account
  I should not be able to create a profile if I do not have an account.
  I should not be able to create a profile if I do not remember my account username and password.

Feature: Account Creation and Profile Setup

  Background: 
    Given the user does not have an existing account

  @account-creation 
  Scenario Outline: User can create an account 
    When the user creates an account with username "<username>" and password "<password>"
    Then the account is successfully created
      
    @test @dev
    Examples:
      | username | password  |
      | user1    | pass123   |
      | user2    | testpass  |

  @profile-setup 
  Scenario Outline: User can create a profile with existing account 
    Given the user has an existing account with username "<username>" and password "<password>"
    When the user creates a profile 
    Then the profile is successfully set up
      
    @test @dev
    Examples:
      | username | password  |
      | user1    | pass123   |
      | user2    | testpass  |

  @no-account 
  Scenario: User cannot create a profile without an existing account
    Given the user does not have an existing account
    When the user tries to create a profile
    Then the profile setup is not completed successfully

  @no-credentials 
  Scenario Outline: User cannot create a profile without remembering account credentials
    Given the user has an existing account with username "<username>" and password "<password>"
    When the user tries to create a profile without entering correct credentials
    Then the profile setup is not completed successfully
      
    @test @dev
    Examples:
      | username | password  |
      | user1    | pass123   |
      | user2    | testpass  |

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to buy the right size cloths for a boy and a girl, so that I can be able to fix the boy and girl with the right size cloths.
  Write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria: 
  I should be able to buy boy cloths between size 20 to 30. 
  I should be able to buy girl cloths between 20 to 25. 
  I should be able to buy boy and girl cloths if right size exist else do not buy. 
  I should be able to buy girl cloths for boy if boy cloths size fit girl. 
  I should be able to buy boy cloths for girl if girl cloth size fit boy. 
  I should be able to buy no cloth if it does not fit boy or girl.

Feature: Buying Clothes for Boys and Girls

  Background: 
    Given the available cloth sizes for boys are between 20 to 30 
    And the available cloth sizes for girls are between 20 to 25 

  @buy-boy-clothes 
  Scenario Outline: Buying clothes for a boy with the right size
    Given the user is buying clothes for a boy 
    When the user selects the size <size> for the boy 
    Then the purchase is successful for the boy 

    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | size | 
      | 25   | 
      | 30   | 

  @buy-girl-clothes 
  Scenario Outline: Buying clothes for a girl with the right size
    Given the user is buying clothes for a girl 
    When the user selects the size <size> for the girl 
    Then the purchase is successful for the girl 

    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | size | 
      | 20   | 
      | 25   | 

  @buy-both-clothes 
  Scenario Outline: Buying clothes for both boy and girl if right sizes exist
    Given the user is buying clothes for both a boy and a girl 
    When the user selects the size <boy_size> for the boy and <girl_size> for the girl 
    Then the purchase is successful for both 

    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | boy_size | girl_size | 
      | 25       | 20        | 

      | boy_size | girl_size | 
      | 30       | 25        | 

  @fit-girl-in-boy-clothes 
  Scenario: Buying girl clothes for a boy if girl cloth size fits boy
    Given the user is buying clothes for a boy 
    And the boy's size is smaller than the largest girl size 
    When the user selects the size <girl_size> for the boy 
    Then the purchase is successful for the boy with girl clothes 

  @fit-boy-in-girl-clothes 
  Scenario: Buying boy clothes for a girl if boy cloth size fits girl
    Given the user is buying clothes for a girl 
    And the girl's size is smaller than the largest boy size 
    When the user selects the size <boy_size> for the girl 
    Then the purchase is successful for the girl with boy clothes 

  @not-fit-any-clothes 
  Scenario: Not able to buy any clothes if it does not fit boy or girl
    Given the user is trying to buy clothes 
    And the selected sizes do not fit either a boy or a girl 
    Then the purchase is unsuccessful and no clothes are bought

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to view user documentation for the website, so that I know how to use the web app.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria:
  I should be able to know how to use the web app if there is a user documentation on the website.
  I should be able to know how to use the web app if the user documentation is easy to understand.
  I should not be able to know how to use the web app if there is no user documentation.
  I should not be able to know how to use the web app if the user documentation page is down

Feature: User Documentation for Website

  Background: 
    Given the website has user documentation 

  @understand 
  Scenario: User able to understand how to use the web app with clear user documentation
    Given the user accesses the user documentation page 
    Then the user should find the instructions easy to follow

  @no-doc 
  Scenario: User unable to know how to use the web app without user documentation
    Given the user cannot find the user documentation page 
    Then the user is unable to understand how to use the web app

  @down 
  Scenario: User unable to know how to use the web app if user documentation page is down
    Given the user tries to access the user documentation page and it is unavailable 
    Then the user is unable to access the instructions for the web app

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature.

9. Include comments if possible.

I want to be able to view a map display of the special waste drop off sites around my area, so that I know where to drop of my special waste.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria:
  I should be able to see special waste site on map if there is any special waste drop off available.
  I should be able to see special waste site on map if the GPS works correctly.
  I should not be able to see special waste site on map if there is not any special waste drop off available.
  I should not be able to see special waste site on map if the internet connection is down

Feature: Special Waste Drop Off Site Map Display

  Background:
    Given the GPS is enabled
    And the internet connection is stable

  @positive
  Scenario: View special waste drop off sites on the map if available
    Given there are special waste drop off sites in the area
    When I view the map display
    Then I should see the special waste sites marked on the map

  @positive
  Scenario: View special waste drop off sites on the map with correct GPS
    Given the GPS is functioning correctly
    And there are special waste drop off sites in the area
    When I view the map display
    Then I should see the special waste sites marked on the map

  @negative
  Scenario: Unable to view special waste drop off sites on the map if not available
    Given there are no special waste drop off sites in the area
    When I view the map display
    Then I should not see any special waste sites marked on the map

  @negative
  Scenario: Unable to view special waste drop off sites on the map with no internet connection
    Given the internet connection is down
    And there are special waste drop off sites in the area
    When I view the map display
    Then I should not see any special waste sites marked on the map

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline.

I want to view all available activity fees online, so that I can easily create a bill statement.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria: 
  I should be able to view some activities fees online if I plan to create a bill statement.
  I should be able to view all activities fees online if I plan to create a bill statement.
  I should be able to view all activities fees online if I plan not to create a bill statement.
  I should not be able to view all activities fees online if the network is down.
  I should not be able to view all activities fees online if there are no activities fees online

Feature: Viewing Activity Fees Online

  Background: 
    Given I plan to create a bill statement 
    
  @view_activities_fees
  Scenario: View some activities fees online
    Given there are some activities fees available online 
    When I view the activities fees online 
    Then I can see some of the activities fees 
    
  @view_all_activities_fees
  Scenario: View all activities fees online for bill statement creation 
    Given there are all activities fees available online 
    When I view all the activities fees online 
    Then I can see all the activities fees 
    
  @view_activities_fees_no_bill
  Scenario: View all activities fees online without bill statement creation 
    Given I do not plan to create a bill statement 
    When I view all the activities fees online 
    Then I can see all the activities fees 
    
  @network_issue
  Scenario: Unable to view all activities fees online due to network issue 
    Given there are activities fees available online 
    When the network is down 
    Then I cannot view all the activities fees 
    
  @no_activities_fees
  Scenario: Unable to view all activities fees online if no activities fees available 
    Given there are no activities fees available online 
    When I try to view the activities fees 
    Then I cannot view any activities fees

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline.

7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to be able to receive tempting rewards, so that I have a reason to use the website.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria: 
  I should be able to receive tempting rewards if I want to use the website.
  I should not be able to receive tempting rewards if I do not want to use the website.
  I should not be able to receive tempting rewards if I want to use the website and do not want any reward.

Feature: Tempting Rewards for Website Usage

  Background: 
    Given a user is using the website 
    
  @receive-rewards 
  Scenario Outline: User receives tempting rewards if willing to use the website
    Given the user wants to use the website 
    And the user desires tempting rewards 
    When the rewards are granted 
    Then the user receives tempting rewards 
    
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | desire_rewards | 
      | true           | 
      
  @no-rewards 
  Scenario Outline: User does not receive tempting rewards if not willing to use the website
    Given the user does not want to use the website 
    When the rewards are checked 
    Then the user does not receive tempting rewards 
    
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | desire_rewards | 
      | false          | 
      
  @no-rewards-on-desire 
  Scenario Outline: User does not receive tempting rewards if wanting to use the website without desiring rewards
    Given the user wants to use the website 
    And the user does not desire any rewards 
    When the rewards are granted 
    Then the user does not receive tempting rewards 
    
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | desire_rewards | 
      | false          |

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to access an API from the website, so that I can integrate it and implement certain features in my own iOS application.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria:
  I should be able to access an API if the access is free.
  I should be able to access an API if I have the API access key.
  I should not be able to access an API if the access key has expired.
  I should not be able to access an API if the access key is wrong.
  I should be able to access an API if the access key has the correct permissions.

Feature: API Access for iOS Application Integration

  Background: 
    Given the API access is free 
          
  @free-access 
  Scenario Outline: User can access the API for free 
    Given the access is free 
    When the user accesses the API 
    Then the access is successful 
          
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | description | 
      | free access | 
          
  @valid-access-key 
  Scenario Outline: User can access the API with a valid access key 
    Given the user has a valid access key 
    When the user accesses the API 
    Then the access is successful 
          
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | description     | 
      | valid access key | 
          
  @expired-access-key 
  Scenario Outline: User cannot access the API with an expired access key 
    Given the user has an expired access key 
    When the user tries to access the API 
    Then the access is denied 
          
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | description      | 
      | expired access key | 
          
  @wrong-access-key 
  Scenario Outline: User cannot access the API with a wrong access key 
    Given the user has a wrong access key 
    When the user tries to access the API 
    Then the access is denied 
          
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | description    | 
      | wrong access key | 
          
  @correct-permissions 
  Scenario Outline: User can access the API with correct permissions 
    Given the user has the correct permissions in the access key 
    When the user accesses the API 
    Then the access is successful 
          
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | description           | 
      | correct permissions |

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to have full access to data related to my company, so that I can have a sense of my company's performance.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria: 
  I should be able to have full access to company data if I have full access priviledge to the data.
  I should be able to have full access to company data if company data has no restrictions to access.
  I should not be able to have full access to company data if I do not have full access priviledge to the data.
  I should be able to have full access to company data if company data has some restrictions to access.
  I should not be able to have full access to company data if I do not have the correct access priviledge to the data

Feature: Company Data Access

  Background: 
    Given the user has full access privilege to company data 
      
  @fullAccess 
  Scenario: User with full access privilege can access all company data 
    Given the user has full access privilege to company data 
    When the user accesses company data 
    Then the user can view all company data 

  @noRestrictions 
  Scenario: User can access company data with no restrictions 
    Given the company data has no restrictions to access 
    When the user accesses company data 
    Then the user can view all company data 

  @limitedAccess 
  Scenario: User with limited access privilege cannot access all company data 
    Given the user does not have full access privilege to company data 
    When the user tries to access company data 
    Then the user cannot view all company data 

  @restrictedAccess 
  Scenario: User can access company data with some restrictions 
    Given the company data has some restrictions to access 
    When the user accesses company data 
    Then the user can view some restricted company data 

  @incorrectAccess 
  Scenario: User with incorrect access privilege cannot access all company data 
    Given the user does not have the correct access privilege to the data 
    When the user tries to access company data 
    Then the user cannot view all company data

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to be able to block specific users based on IP address, so that I can prevent spamming on the websites.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria:
  I should be able to block specific users based on IP address if user IP address is on the blocking list.
  I should not be able to block specific users based on IP address if user IP address is not on the blocking list.

Feature: Block Users by IP Address

  Background: 
    Given a list of blocked IP addresses 
          
  @blockIP 
  Scenario Outline: Block specific user based on IP address in the blocking list 
    Given user IP address is <ip_address> 
    And the IP address is on the blocking list 
    When the user is blocked 
    Then the user is prevented from accessing the website 
          
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | ip_address     | 
      | 192.168.1.1    | 
      | 10.0.0.1       | 
          
  @dontBlockIP 
  Scenario Outline: Do not block specific user based on IP address not in the blocking list 
    Given user IP address is <ip_address> 
    And the IP address is not on the blocking list 
    When the user is not blocked 
    Then the user can access the website 
          
    @test @dev 
    Examples: 
      | ip_address       | 
      | 172.16.0.1       | 
      | 200.100.50.25    |

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to be able to check transaction history and keep a record of it, so that I can go back when needed.
  write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria: 
  I should be able to check transaction history and keep a record of transaction history if I have the permission to check transaction history and keep record.
  I should not be able to check transaction history and keep a record of transaction history if I do not have the permission to check transaction history and keep record.
  I should be able to check only transaction history and not keep a record of transaction history if I have the permission to check transaction history and not keep record.
  I should be able to check transaction history and keep a record of it if I want to keep record.
  I should be able to keep a record of transaction history if I have only permission to check transaction history

Feature: Transaction History Management
  
  Background: 
    Given the user has permission to check transaction history and keep record
          
  @check-record 
  Scenario: User checks transaction history and keeps a record
    Given the user wants to check transaction history and keep a record
    When the user checks the transaction history
    Then the user successfully keeps a record of the transaction history
          
  @no-permission 
  Scenario: User without permission cannot check transaction history or keep a record
    Given the user does not have permission to check transaction history and keep record
    When the user tries to check transaction history or keep a record
    Then the action is not allowed
          
  @check-only 
  Scenario: User checks transaction history only without keeping a record
    Given the user has permission to check transaction history but not keep record
    When the user checks the transaction history
    Then the user can view the transaction history without keeping a record

You are a Quality assurance engineer. You are an expect in writing test scenarios with test cases in BDD Gherkin style. 
You always take into consideration all edge cases and includes both positive and negative scenarios. 
You always write test scenarios with test cases and include detail examples for each. 
You always follow a set of instructions to create test scenarios with test cases. 
You always follow the instructions below: 
1. Always start BDD Gherkin style with 'Feature:' keyword. 
2. Use 'Scenario Outline:' instead of 'Scenario:'. 
3. Include steps in the Background if they are repeated at the beginning of all Scenario Outline in a Feature. 
4. Background step should come before every Scenario Outline. 
5. Tags are written with '@{descriptive-test}' {descriptive-test}=summary of the individual Feature or Scenario Outline. 
6. Put tags at the line on top of only Feature and Scenario Outline and not Examples to annotate it. 
7. Include Examples for each Scenario Outline. 8.  Use '@test @dev' to annotate Examples. 
9. Include comments if possible.

I want to sending and withdrawing money by adults and non-adults, so that I can be able to make transactions for my business.
  Write at least three test scenarios with cases.  
  Using BDD Gherkin style. Follow these criteria: 
  I should be an adult. 
  I should be able to withdraw money if adult. 
  I should be able to send money if adult. 
  I should not be able to send more than 20 euros of money if not adult. 
  I should be able to send any amount of money if I am only an adult.

Feature: Money Transactions for Adult and Non-Adult Users

  Background: 
    Given the user is an adult 
          
  @withdraw 
  Scenario: Adult user successfully withdraws money 
    When the adult user withdraws 50 euros 
    Then the withdrawal is successful 
           
  @send 
  Scenario: Adult user successfully sends money 
    When the adult user sends 30 euros 
    Then the money transfer is successful 
          
  @send-limit 
  Scenario: Non-adult user attempting to send over 20 euros is prevented 
    Given the user is not an adult 
    When the non-adult user tries to send 25 euros 
    Then the transaction is blocked
